entry.title: Movie: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World, starring Michael Cera (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World, starring Michael Cera (2010)20131112
This is such a brilliant movie. I laughed so many times and I've
seen it multiple times. I think the veganism thing is the best
part.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993) (4)20131110
I played for a very long time today over a bunch of different
sessions. I went all the way from the end of Krypt to Tunlan and
looking at the Princess' back tattoo. I feel like some parts of
the game are going by very quickly. I really enjoy listening to
Bleu and the way her character acts. This game is very fun and I'm
surprised that I don't remember it more fondly, since I'm enjoying
it so much.

Total time: 14:34
  • Video Games
  • Breath of Fire
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Movie: King of Chinatown, directed by Jordan Levinson (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: King of Chinatown, directed by Jordan Levinson (2010)20131109
My wife and I watched this movie. It's pretty interesting, but
mainly just about how crazy Empire Arcadia is and not because it
focus on what's cool about Justin Wong. It's totally bizarre.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: The Colony, starring Kevin Zegers (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Colony, starring Kevin Zegers (2013)20131107
This movie started off very cool and with a unique concept. Once
the bad guys appeared, it started to go down hill as it reveled in
gore a bit too much and lost its heady/intellectual base. I think
it really totally falls apart when they get back to their home
colony and it becomes a giant fight. They even make sure that the
cannibals never speak and were black masks, so that you dehumanize
them and treat them like zombies/animals.

The movie shows that it totally lost its soul in the final line
when Sam says that there is only one rule left: Survive. The
problem with this is that it goes against what the movie is about:
the fact that cannibalism is never okay and you shouldn't do it,
even though it could help you survive. Unless, of course, they
meant it in some deep way where Sam has had his evilness unlocked
by smashing off the head of the bad guy, but I doubt that.

After looking at the Wikipedia page, I was impressed by the super
small budget.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993) (3)20131106
I played for about three hours tonight. I got through the Crypt. I
am on the deepest fetch quest sequence I can remember in a long
time. I'm trying to get to a place, so I need a Ship, so I need to
save a Daughter, so I need to get a Light Key, so I need to get
Karn, so I need to get a Book, so I need to get a Fife, so I need
to get an Icicle, so I need to get a Gold Bar, so I need to get a
bunch of money. Yikes!

The Gold Town is very funny because their houses really do have
awesome stuff to steal and it's the only place where you can get
in trouble for taking stuff from their houses.

I feel like the Nina "massage" sequence must have been censored
from the Japanese.

Total time: 8:30
  • Video Games
  • Breath of Fire
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (9)20131105
I spent about two hours grinding while watching a movie. I didn't
advance the plot or anything, so I don't have anything real to
report, except that I got about 4 normals levels and 8 job
levels. My Monk is Job Level 70! Woah!

Total time: 13:00

entry.title: Movie: The Way Way Back, starring Liam James (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Way Way Back, starring Liam James (2013)20131105
This was a much sweeter movie than I thought it would be. The
Wikipedia summary makes it sound really depressing, but I found it
pretty inspiring as Duncan broke out of his shell. The ending was a
bit depressing though, because it isn't really ending on a real
triumph for anyone.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Driven, starring Sylvester Stallone (2001)
entry.content:
Movie: Driven, starring Sylvester Stallone (2001)20131104
This was a fun little movie about race cars. I felt like there were
way too many crashes and that there would not normally be that
many, but I don't really know. I felt like they did a good job
trying to explain racing too. A lot of the effects were really bad
and some of the acting was pretty laughable. But, given that there
are basically no movies about racing, it will have to do.
  • Movies
  • 2001

entry.title: Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993) (2)20131103
I played today for about three hours and go the Ring after the
Stone Robot. It's fun. I don't remember it being so painful to
switch characters on the field to use their ability. I also found
the "Find Agua" part very confusing because I had no idea where it
was or how to get to it.

Total time: 5:20

entry.title: Movie: War, Inc., starring John Cusack (2008)
entry.content:
Movie: War, Inc., starring John Cusack (2008)20131103
This movie was a funny satire that felt like a super-political
sequel to Grosse Pointe Blank. It was a lot of fun with all sorts
of wild moments. It's hard to summarize what all the funny moments
were, but I was chuckling most of the way through.
  • Movies
  • 2008

entry.title: Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Breath of Fire (SNES, 1993)20131102
I played for about three hours. I got to where Nina gets captured
and Ryu has to go save her. I like the Nina is initially
self-sufficient and her peril is just a matter of the special
magic of the Wizard. This game is very nostalgic for me and it has
a cute world of weird animal people. I have fonder memories of the
second one, but I still like this. The battle system is very
basic, but pretty streamlined, which is nice.

Total time: 2:37
  • Video Games
  • Breath of Fire
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Movie: The Internship, starring Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Internship, starring Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson (2013)20131101
This was a cute and silly movie. It was clearly trying to bring
back the feeling of the Wedding Crashers for the modern age. It was
pretty cute and had lots of silly moments. I enjoyed it... except
for the gratuitous nudity. That was absurd. I think my favorite
part was when they were talking about text editors and Owen Wilson
said that Ubuntu should change the default to emacs and everyone
was like "Yea!"
  • Movies
  • 2013

I finished the book today. I did not enjoy the essays.

entry.title: Movie: White House Down, starring Channing Tatum (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: White House Down, starring Channing Tatum (2013)20131028
This was a great movie. I enjoyed it a lot more than "Olympus Has
Fallen". I think I liked it better because it more "home-y" and had
more than just action elements: there was Tatum's romancing family
wholesomeness, the comedic moments, the variety of styles of action
scenes, and the mystery of what exactly was happening. I enjoyed it
quite a bit. Roland Emmerich is pretty great.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (8)20131027
I played for about two hours today and finished the Tide Cave,
unlocked part of the Dark World, and got the Water Crystal jobs. I
don't plan on using any of them, but I will use Earth Crystal
jobs---Devout and Black Belt, I think. I died my first time
against Krakken, so I grinded a bit to get my Knights to do more
damage (although they are nowhere near as good as my Warriors
were) and then I went back to the Light World to get the Light
Staff for the healer. After doing all this, it was tight but not
too hard.

Total time: 11:13
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 3 (remake)
  • DS
  • 2006

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (11)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (11)20131027
I finished the main book today, although I will still read the
essays that are attached to it. The majority of the end of the book
kind of falls apart and is hard to appreciate today, unlike the
opening which feels very pertinent.
  • Books
  • 1651

entry.title: Movie: The Long Ranger, starring Armie Hammer (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Long Ranger, starring Armie Hammer (2013)20131027
This was fun movie. I haven't watched a Western in a long time, so
it felt fresh to be in that world. I thought that the movie was
trying way too hard to be something like Pirates. Tonto's weird
quirks and some of the action moments are the best examples. I felt
like the plot was all over the place and the movie went a very long
distance throughout it. I didn't feel confused, but I could easily
imagine why someone might be confused. I didn't like the
presentation it had of Indians, despite seeming to be on their
side. Overall, I enjoyed the movie, but thought it could have been
better.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: After Earth, starring Jaden Smith (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: After Earth, starring Jaden Smith (2013)20131026
This was a fun movie. I liked the world that it created and the
chase-like drama of it. I thought the acting and details of the
story were mostly forgettable. The idea that warriors had to evolve
to throw away all their emotions is cool, but naturally creates
robotic acting as Will is good at it and Jaden tries to imitate the
emotionless style.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Jobs, starring Ashton Kutcher (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Jobs, starring Ashton Kutcher (2013)20131025
This was a fun movie. I enjoyed seeing Jobs struggle knowing that
he was so successful in the long-run. I feel like a lot of the
later technical achievements and little things like the motherboard
layout and innovations at NeXT were wrongly missed.
  • Movies
  • 2013
